results.title: Acute Alcohol Withdrawal
considerations: Patient and Crew Safety due to patient anxiety, etc

results.title: ACS, STEMI, NSTEMI
considerations: TIME IS HEART
Consider helistop rendezvous
Consult cardiology prior to transport (if applicable)
Arrange for transport to Cath Lab
Coordinate with sending team to reduce time at sending location
Round Trip ground transport by Aero Med medical team NOT indicated if STEMI
testAndStudies: Do not delay transport for pending test results
checklist: Pain level (0-10) at time of arrival and delivery
otherConsiderations: Brilinta may be crushed and administered via OGT/NGT

results.title: Anaphylaxis
considerations: Consider early airway intervention

results.title: Aortic Aneurysm and Dissection
considerations: This is potentially a surgical emergency.
Being coordination with accepting facility/surgeon ASAP
Take blood into sending facility
interventions: Hang blood tubing in anticipation of transfusion
Check pulses and BP in all 4 extremities
impressions: Abdominal Aneurysm, Without Mention of Rupture
otherConsiderations: Treatment may vary (surgical versus medical) depending on aneurysm location

results.title: Unstable Arrhythmias
considerations: Stabilize prior to transport
Notify PIC prior to defibrillation/cardioversion

results.title: Arterial Occlusion
considerations: Transport with affected extremity in position of comfort
This is a surgically urgent/emergent diagnosis
Pulses via Doppler
Examine for changes ruing transport (worsening or loss of pulses)
interventions: Anticoagulants as directed by vascular surgeon
impressions: Arterial Embolism and Thrombosis of Unspecified Artery

results.title: Asthma and COPD
considerations: Ensure adequate amount of nebulizer medications for transport
If on Heliox must be transported by ground with RT
interventions: Use of asthma/COPD ase ventilator settings (PEEP 0-5)
Beware of auto-PEEP and pneumothorax during air transport phase

results.title: Carbon Monoxide Poisoning
considerations: Appropriate Receiving Facility (consider HBO)
Anticipate multiple patients
Ensure adequate oxygen availability for transport
interventions: 100% NRB or 100% FIO2 if intubated or CPAP
Screen for pregnancy, cardiac signs and symptoms
checklist: Route and FIO2 of Oxygen Administration
otherConsiderations: Consider other possible toxic exposure (Cyanide, polydrug)

results.title: Cardiac Arrest / Arrest After Flight Team Arrival
considerations: Do NOT life if patient is an adult in Cardiac Arrest
May consider lift if pediatric
Follow ACLS/PALS/NRP guidelines
If arrest occurs during transport phase and unnsuccessful in ROSC
During loading phase return to ED
During flight phase:
Consider continuing to destination and divert to ED
Notify flight communications and request additional help on helistop
Notify PIC prior to defibrillation or cardioversion
Do not attempt during takeoff or landing
interventions: Place pads on all patients who are unstable
Consider therapeutic hypothermia protocol if ROSC
otherConsiderations: Discuss code status and possible diversion with family prior to departure if arrest anticipated
See Declaration of Death Cessation of Resuscitation Efforts SOP

results.title: Congestive Heart Failure and Pulmonary Edema
considerations: Transport in a position of comfort (HOB elevated)

results.title: Disseminated Instravascular Coagulation
considerations: Determine need for blood products (e.g. FFP) and consider obtaining from SHBWH prior to arrival at sending hospital
Consultation with Obstetrician prior to launch and/or during appropriate phases of transport (if applicable)
interventions: Correct coagulopathy only if at high risk for bleeding, active bleeding or prior to required invasive procedure
Examples:  Sepsis, Retained products of conception

results.title: Electrolyte Imbalance and Renal Failure
considerations: Appropriate receiving facility able to administer dialysis
interventions: Correct acidosis FIRST in presence of hyperkalemia
Appropriate fluid management and output monitoring
Do not correct hyponatremia too quickly
medications: Insulin with D50. Check glucose prior to administration and hold D50 if severely hyperglycemic
Calcium Chloride (only if QRS complex widening
checklist: Fistula Exam or Dialysis port site exam if applicable
otherConsiderations: No BP in extremity if fistula present and pass information on in report

results.title: Epiglottitis
considerations: Direct sending physician to request Operating Room and Anesthesia for intubation prior to transport
Request Ceftriaxone
interventions: Airway management prior to transport. Discuss alternate plan for advanced airway or surgical airway (needlecric <10 y/o). Intubate->Bag->Cric. If able to maintain with BVM consider waiting on more advanced airway
Ensure first dose of antibiotics given
Use "hands off approach" until intubated. Reduce Anxiety
testAndStudies: X-Ray lateral soft tissue of neck
checklist: Airway Management interventions and reevaluation after all phases of movement
otherConsiderations: Avoid venipuncture and invasive procedures until airway secured

results.title: GI Bleed
considerations: Blakemore tube:  one kg of cephlad traction
DO NOT DEFLATE BALLOON
Request FFP from sending prior to departure to expedite thawing process
interventions: 2 large bore IVs with blood tubing
Consider IO (not central line) if difficult access

Blood product transfusion. If no radial pulse or blood pressure <80 systolic. Take type and crossed blood products from sending only. If universal blood products, prepped by sending, leave unless massive transfusion is anticipated.
medications: If upper GI bleed. Protonix gtt. Octreotide gtt
Vitamin K if life threatening bleed and coags not within normal limits

results.title: Hyperglycemia and Diabetic Ketoacidosis and Hyperosmolar Nonketotic Coma
interventions: Determine underlying cause and treat. For example:  MI, Infection, Non-Compliance
If BS less than 200 mg/dL, administer D5NS (add 2 Amps of D50 to 1 L NS @ maintenance rate and adjust for effect) while continuing Insulin drip
medications: Sodium Bicarbonate ONLY if pH less than 6.9

results.title: Hypertensive Crisis
considerations: Monitor BP q 5 minutes and as needed
Prepare for a-line monitoring
interventions: Decrease MAP by 30% from initial presentation
otherConsiderations: Monitor for decreased cerebral blood flow and CVA symptoms

results.title: LVAD (HeartMate II LVAS) Transport Considerations
considerations: Request spare batteries from sending/patient
Ask patient/Family for specific information regarding device
Must always be connected to a power source
Do not unplug power base unit with patient attached
Never disconnect both cables at the same time-pump will stop
Refer to patient's pocket alarm guide for any pump alarms
CONTACT LVAD COORDINATOR VIA PAGER/PHONE
interventions: Discuss transport considerations with receving physician prior to departure
Listen over left chest for hum of pump
otherConsiderations: Risk of device displacement with chest compressions
Will not have a palpable pulse

results.title: Meningitis
considerations: Implement Isolation precautions for entire flight/transport crew
otherConsiderations: If less than ONE month old, request medication guidance from intensivist

results.title: Necrotizing Fasciitis
considerations: Surgical intervention is required ASAP so consider transfer of care in OR at receiving hospital
checklist: Pain out of proportion to injury or presentation

results.title: Pulmonary Embolus
considerations: Handle with care avoiding extreme or jarring movement
HOB elevated
interventions: Airway/ventilator management with aggressive FIO2/PEEP using ARDS Net Scale
medications: Thrombolytics (if in shock after consultation with receiving physician)

results.title: Respiratory Failure
considerations: Ensure adequate oxygen supply for transport
HOB elevated
Adequate Nebulizer medications for continuous administration
EtCO2
Monitor for pneumothorax
interventions: Utilize appropriate ventilator settings per diagnosis
impressions: Respiratory failure. Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome
Pertinent associated diagnosis (i.e. pneumonia, COPD, status, asthmaticus, etc.)
otherConsiderations: For intubated pediatric patients consider using spinal immobilization device to reduce incidence of endotracheal tube displacement

results.title: Sepsis
considerations: Obtain antibiotics prior to departure from sending and begin transfusion ASAP
interventions: Aggressive fluid resuscitation of 500-1000 mL every 15 minutes to goal of MAP of >65 or CVP >8
Intubate if hypoxia or increased work of breathing
medications: Antibiotics with coverage for MRSA and Pseudomonas
Blood if Hgb <10 or HCT <30 and SVO2 below 70 and Oxygen now working
otherConsiderations: Aggressive search for source may require early surgical intervention

results.title: Sickle Cell Crisis
considerations: Transport at the lowest safe altitude

results.title: Status Epilepticus and Seizures
considerations: Safety of patient if actively seizing
interventions: Rapid termination of seizure activity. Seizure >30 minutes may lead to brain damage
If chemically paralyzed may still be seizing
Consider PR medications if IV/IO access not immediately available
checklist: Medication intervention prior to AM arrival and during transport
First seizure or history of seizures
otherConsiderations: Drug doses vary in pediatric patient

results.title: Stroke, Hemorrhagic
considerations: Appropriate receiving facility with Neurosurgeon (if applicable)
Consider arranging for FFP if anticipated
interventions: Mannitol if signs and symptoms of herniation

results.title: Stroke, Ishemic
considerations: Appropriate Receiving facility (Neurologist)
Clarify BP control perimeters with receiving physician
interventions: Avoid significant, rapid drops in blood pressure due to medication administration
Be prepared to treat for seizure activity
testAndStudies: Head CT (especially if tPA is being considered)
impressions: Cerebral Artery Occlusion with cerebral infarction
otherConsiderations: Refer to SH Rural Stroke Clinical Pathway

results.title: Thrombocytopenia and Heparin Induced Thrombocytopenia
considerations: If life threatening bleeding present, consider obtaining blood products from BWH (platelets) prior to arriving at sending hospital
interventions: Transfuse platelets only if life threatening bleeding present (or at direction of receiving physician)
DO NOT transfuse platelets if TTP is possible or schistocytes are present on blood smear unless death imminent due to uncontrolled bleeding
checklist: Bleeding location and amount if applicable

results.title: Toxic Ingestion and Exposure
considerations: Poison Control Number:  800-222-1222
Spectrum Health BWH Toxicology Service:
Poison Control consultation prior to departure from AM in case of antidote needed from BWH
Consider need for decontamination and ground transport as an alternative to air transport
interventions: Indentify possible substance exposed to or ingested
testAndStudies: Miscellaneous Drug Levels. For Example:  Digoxin, Lithium, Dilantin, etc.
checklist: Possible toxin, amount ingested or exposed to and time of exposure
otherConsiderations: Transport bottles of substance or medications if possible and not harmful to crew/patient

results.title: Violent or Combative Patient
considerations: Safety of patient and crew is the primary concern
Consider ground transport as alternative
Restrain patient prior to loading onto aircraft
Consider contacting AOC
interventions: Evaluate for physical and/or chemical restraint administration. RSI
Consider medical etiology for behavior (anoxia, hypercarbia, hypertensive crisis) adn intervene appropriately
checklist: Neurovascular status (extremity pulses) before & after restrains are applied and as required
otherConsiderations: Consider use of pediatric spine board with pediatric patient
